details.purpose: To record detailed findings about prostate cancer found on microscopic examination.
details.use: To record detailed findings about microscopic examination of prostate cancer as part of an anatomical pathology result. Use as a component archetype in the context of a suite of archetypes that make up a histopathology report ie OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.
details.misuse: Not designed to be used within any other archetype other than OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.

description.other_contributors: Koray Atalag, University of Auckland, New Zealand
description.other_details:
Royal College of Pathologists of Australasia. Prostate Cancer (Radical Prostatectomy) Structured Reporting Protocol (1st Edition 2010). [Internet]. 2010;[cited 2010 Mar 21 ] Available from: http://www.rcpa.edu.au//static/File/Asset%20library/public%20documents/Publications/StructuredReporting/PROSTATE%20CANCER%20RAD%20PROS%20STRUCTURED%20REPORTING%20PROTOCOL%20for%20web.pdf
Royal College of Pathologists. Dataset for prostate cancer histopathology reports [Internet]. 2009 ;[cited 2009 Jul 30 ] Available from: http://www.rcpath.org/index.asp?PageID=1164
College of American Pathologists. Protocol for the examination of specimens from patients with invasive carcinomas of the prostate gland [Internet]. 2007 Apr ;[cited 2009 Jul 30 ] Available from: http://www.cap.org/apps/docs/committees/cancer/cancer_protocols/2006/prostate06_ckw.pdf

items.description: Microscopic anatomical pathology findings related to prostate cancer.
Gleason Score (ISUP2005 version) - a prostate cancer grading score ratified by the International Society of Urological Pathologists (ISUP).
Findings related to tumour at multiple surgical resection margins.
Findings related to the involvement of tumour in lymph nodes.
Dimensions of the dominant tumour node.
Details of tumour at an individual surgical resection margin.
Details of tumour at a single lymph node.
Estimate of 3D volume of the primary prostate tumour.
Qualitative estimate of the amount of primary prostate tumour.
Estimate of the amount of primary prostate tumour.
Proportion of prostate tissue involved by tumour.
Where tumour has been found incidentally on histopathological examination, the extent of tumour found. This is used as part of the cTNM classification of prostate cancer.

items.text: Tumour incidental histologic finding in no more than 5% of tissue resected
items.description: Prostate tumour is an incidental histologic finding in no more than 5% of tissue resected.

items.text: Tumour incidental histologic finding in more than 5% of tissue resected
items.description: Prostate tumour is an incidental histological finding in more than 5% of tissue resected.
Proportion of tumour positive prostate cores out of the total number of prostate cores.
The primary Gleason score.
Findings of tumour involvement in seminal vesicles.
Tumour is present in both seminal vesicles.
Tumour is present in only the left seminal vesicle.
Tumour is present in only the right seminal vesicle.
Tumour is absent from both seminal vesicle.
Presence of tumour in seminal vesicles has not been determined.
Additional histological finding related to prostate cancer.
Additional histological findings related to prostate cancer.
Findings related to tumour involvement in seminal vesicles.
The secondary Gleason score.
The tertiary Gleason score.
The Gleason score at a surgical margin involved with tumour.
A description of the methodology used to estimate tumour volume.
Tissue inflammation is present.
High grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PIN) is present.
Atypical adenomatous hyperplasia is present.
The sum of the primary, secondary and tertiary Gleason scores.

items.text: Ratio of linear distance of carcinoma to length of cores
items.description: Ratio of the linear distance of prostatic carcinoma to the length of prostatic cores.
A description of the method and result of other type of quantification.
Minimal tumour is present.
Unifocal tumour is present.
Multifocal or extensive tumour is present.
A qualitative estimate of tumour volume has not been determined.
Nodular prostatic hyperplasia is present.
Additional pathological findings are absent.
A text description of additional pathological findings.
Quantification results from specimens obtained by fine needle aspiration biopsy (FNAB).
Quantification results from a specimen obtained by transurethral resection (TUR).
Proportion of tumour positive prostatic chips out of the total number of prostatic chips.
Quantification results from specimens obtained from open surgical resection.
Findings related to a single surgical resection margin.
Findings of the relation of the resection margin to the prostatic capsule.
The surgical margin has been developed within the prostatic capsule. Sometimes termed 'capsular incision' (CI).
The surgical margin has been developed external to the prostatic capsule.
The relation of the surgical margin to the prostatic capsule has not been determined.
Details of tumour invasion to local tissues.
The extent of tumour incidental histologic finding has not been determined.
A text description of seminal vesicle involvement by tumour.
Tumour is present in seminal vesicles..
Finding of benign glands at the surgical margin
The cancerous prostate closely resembles normal prostate tissue. The glands are small, well-formed, and closely packed.
The tissue still has well-formed glands, but they are larger and have more tissue between them.
The tissue still has recognizable glands, but the cells are darker. At high magnification, some of these cells have left the glands and are beginning to invade the surrounding tissue.
The tissue has few recognizable glands. Many cells are invading the surrounding tissue.
The tissue does not have recognizable glands. There are often just sheets of cells throughout the surrounding tissue.
The cancerous prostate closely resembles normal prostate tissue. The glands are small, well-formed, and closely packed.
The tissue still has well-formed glands, but they are larger and have more tissue between them.
The tissue still has recognizable glands, but the cells are darker. At high magnification, some of these cells have left the glands and are beginning to invade the surrounding tissue.
The tissue has few recognizable glands. Many cells are invading the surrounding tissue.
The tissue does not have recognizable glands. There are often just sheets of cells throughout the surrounding tissue.
The cancerous prostate closely resembles normal prostate tissue. The glands are small, well-formed, and closely packed.
The tissue still has well-formed glands, but they are larger and have more tissue between them.
The tissue still has recognizable glands, but the cells are darker. At high magnification, some of these cells have left the glands and are beginning to invade the surrounding tissue.
The tissue has few recognizable glands. Many cells are invading the surrounding tissue.
The tissue does not have recognizable glands. There are often just sheets of cells throughout the surrounding tissue.
Benign glands are present at the surgical margin.
Benign glands are absent from the surgical margin
Presence of benign glands at the surgical margin has not been determined.
Finding of involvement by tumour of the bladder neck.
Blaader neck involvement by tumour is present.
Bladder neck involvement by tumour is absent.
Bladder neck involvement by tumour has not been determined.
Findings of tumour zone.
Finding of zone(s) involved by tumour.
Peripheral zone is involved by tumour.
Central zone is involved by tumour.
Transition zone is involved by tumour.
Qualitative estimate of the amount of primary prostate tumour. (synthesised)
Where tumour has been found incidentally on histopathological examination, the extent of tumour found. This is used as part of the cTNM classification of prostate cancer. (synthesised)
Findings of the relation of the resection margin to the prostatic capsule. (synthesised)
Finding of benign glands at the surgical margin (synthesised)
Findings of tumour involvement in seminal vesicles. (synthesised)
Finding of involvement by tumour of the bladder neck. (synthesised)
Finding of zone(s) involved by tumour. (synthesised)
Additional histological finding related to prostate cancer. (synthesised)
The primary Gleason score. (synthesised)
The secondary Gleason score. (synthesised)
